metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5009 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The handle_command function in mon/Monitor.cc in Ceph allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and ceph monitor crash) via an (1) empty or (2) crafted prefix.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-common - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-fs-common - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-fuse - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-mds - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-resource-agents - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-test - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs-java - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs-jni - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs1 - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librados2 - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libradosstriper1 - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librbd1 - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librgw2 - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-ceph - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-cephfs - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-rados - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-rbd - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
radosgw - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-fuse - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-mirror - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-nbd - 10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ceph package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
